newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: PRESS DIGEST - Czech Republic - Sept 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Czech Republic - Sept 18.

text.p: HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - The Czech National Bank (CNB) put the largest fully-private Czech bank, Agrobanka, into temporary forced administration on Tuesday. President Vaclav Havel said he had full confidnce in CNB governer Josef Tosovsky's ability to handle the situation.

- Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus agreed with the leader of the opposition Milos Zeman (CSSD) that a parliamentary commission should be set up to look into the collapse of Kredtni Banka. The failure of Kreditni was partly responsible for the subsequent problems at Agrobanka.
- President Havel is in Brazil on the first leg of a 14 day official visait to South America.
- Motoinvest boss Pavel Tykac left the Czech Republic.
MLADA FRONTA DNES - Setuza said it would pay a dividend amounting to around 30 crowns per share on its 1995 profits.
PRAVO - The Communist party says it will propose a vote of no confidence in the government.
